feed.title: NewsTracker: state islamic
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: A secret to IS success: Shock troops who fight to the death
entry.summary: "People go to the Islamic State looking to die, and the Islamic State is happy to help them."

entry.title: A Secret to IS Success: Shock Troops Who Fight to the Death
entry.summary:
They are the Islamic State group's elite shock troops.

Though best known for its horrific brutalities, the Islamic State group has proved to be a highly organized and flexible fighting force, according to senior Iraqi military and intelligence officials and Syrian Kurdish commanders on the front lines.

entry.title: A secret to IS success: Shock troops who fight to the death
entry.summary: BAGHDAD (AP) - Bearded and wearing bright blue bandanas, the Islamic State group's "special forces" unit gathered around their commander just before they attacked the central Syrian town of al-Sukhna.

entry.title: US military chiefs face tough questioning from senators
entry.summary: Carter backed the president's policy while acknowledging that more needs to be done to strengthen the mission to train local forces to combat the Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Spanish woman arrested for recruiting girls, teens for IS
entry.summary: The ministry said the woman in Arrecife maintained contact with Islamic State militants in Syria, including a facilitator who gave her orders for recruiting girls and arranging their travel to Syria.

entry.title: US military chiefs face tough questioning on Islamic State
US military chiefs face tough questioning on Islamic State
entry.summary: McCain said Islamic State continues to gain territory in Iraq and Syria, while expanding its influence across the Middle East, Africa and Central Asia.

entry.title: Spanish woman arrested for recruiting girls to Islamic State
entry.summary: MADRID -- Spanish police on Tuesday arrested a woman suspected of recruiting pre-teen girls and teenagers to send to areas controlled by the Islamic State armed group in Syria.

entry.title: Syrian Kurds retake northern villages from Islamic State: monitor
entry.summary:
The YPG, backed by small Syrian rebel groups, has made significant gains against Islamic State in Raqqa province in recent weeks, seizing Tel Abyad at the Turkish border on June 15 before advancing south to Ain Issa.

While the YPG has shown itself to be a potent force in the fight against Islamic State, its effectiveness is seen to diminish beyond the predominantly Kurdish areas it was set up to defend in northern and northeastern Syria.

entry.title: Kenya says Islamic extremists kill 14 in Kenya's north
HSBC bank staff sacked for Islamic State beheading prank
HSBC fires 6 staff for mock Islamic State execution video
entry.summary: British bank HSBC fired six staff after they filmed a mock Islamic State-style execution video during a team-building day out and posted footage online, a spokesman confirmed on Tuesday.

entry.title: Obama at Pentagon for meetings on Islamic State
entry.summary: President Barack Obama, right, sits next to Defense Secretary Ash Carter, with other military personnel as they wait to receives an update on the Islamic State group at the Pentagon on Monday, July 6, 2015.

entry.title: Israel arrests 6 Bedouin for supporting Islamic State group
entry.summary: JERUSALEM (AP) " Israel's Shin Bet security agency says it has arrested six Bedouin for establishing a cell supportive of the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Israel Arrests 6 Bedouin for Supporting Islamic State Group
White House criticizes Senate for not approving appointments to counter Islamic State
entry.summary: WASHINGTON The White House criticized Republicans in the U.S. Senate on Monday for not approving appointments aimed at fighting the Islamic State.

entry.title: Obama heads to Pentagon for meetings on Islamic State
entry.summary: President Barack Obama will pay a rare visit to the Pentagon on Monday to get an update from military leaders on the campaign against the Islamic State.

entry.title: Kuwait detains 26 over Islamic State suicide attack on mosque -newspaper
entry.summary:
The June 26 attack by Islamic State militants jolted Kuwait, raising the spectre of sectarian strife in the Gulf Arab oil exporting state.

He said other suspects, including fighters with Islamic State abroad, have been identified and that some of their relatives inside Kuwait have been charged in connection with the blast.

entry.title: Islamic State suicide bombers strike in Iraqi refinery town
entry.summary:
The latest Islamic State offensive comes after authorities said they controlled nearly the whole town and expected to drive insurgents from the refinery within days.

Baiji mayor Mahmoud al-Jabouri said there had been a pattern of withdrawals by Islamic State fighters in the town followed by counter-offensives.

"Islamic State fighters are still holding positions in three neighborhoods in Baiji and they are still receiving reinforcements," said one of the army colonels.

entry.title: Islamic State attacks Syrian army and Kurds in twin assault
entry.summary: Islamic State advanced rapidly last month, seizing cities in Syria and Iraq.

entry.title: Deadly strikes by US-led coalition targeting IS in Raqqa
entry.summary: The airstrikes were confirmed by the coalition, Raqqa-base activists and the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Islamic State says it destroyed archaeological pieces from Palmyra
entry.summary:
The Islamic State group says it has destroyed six archaeological pieces from the historic town of Palmyra that were confiscated from a smuggler.

An IS statement says the busts were found when the smuggler was stopped at a checkpoint and was later referred to an Islamic which ordered that they be destroyed and the man be whipped.

The issue was referred to an Islamic court in the northern Syrian town of Manbij, which ordered that they be destroyed and the man be whipped.

entry.title: U.S. Drone Strike Kills Senior ISIS Leader
entry.summary:
(WASHINGTON) - A coalition airstrike in Syria has killed a senior Islamic State leader, who has been responsible for moving fighters and weapons from Libya to Syria, the Pentagon said Thursday.

Davis said al-Harzi's death will hurt the Islamic State's ability to move foreign fighters in and out of the region.

Last September, the U.S. Treasury Department imposed economic sanctions on al-Harzi and seven other individuals that it said have helped finance or facilitate the movement of foreign fighters joining the Islamic State and the Nusra Front.

entry.title: U.S. drone strike kills senior Islamic State leader
entry.summary: The Treasury statement identified him as the Islamic State group's "amir of suicide bombers," saying he recruited foreign fighters for suicide attacks in Iraq and Syria.

entry.title: Syrian Kurds, on the offensive, push deeper into Islamic State territory
entry.summary:
A spokesman for the Pentagon said last week Islamic State forces had appeared to "crack" at the Turkish border town of Tel Abyad, which fell to the YPG in less than two days, cutting Islamic State's supply route from Turkey.

The Kurdish front in northern Syria has been one of the few sources of good news for the global campaign against Islamic State since the jihadists made major advances last month in western Iraq and central Syria.

entry.title: Islamic State threatens to topple Hamas in Gaza
entry.summary: "At the same time, within Gaza, ISIS (Islamic State) has been flouting Hamas. But they have common cause against the Jews, in Israel or abroad."

entry.title: Islamic State beheads female civilians for first time in Syria for 'sorcery': monitor
entry.summary:
A member to the Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) waves an ISIL flag in Raqqa.

Islamic State also "crucified" five men in al-Mayadeen for eating during daylight hours of the Muslim fasting month of Ramadan, the Observatory said.

Activists say Islamic State uses such public punishments in areas where it is present to control the local population through coercion and fear.

Australian Reece Harding killed fighting Islamic...

entry.title: Syrian troops regain neighborhood they lost earlier in battles with Islamic State group
France links beheading, gas plant attack to Islamic State
entry.summary:
French investigators have uncovered links between Islamic State militants and the man who hung his employer's severed head at a gas plant he was attacking, a prosecutor said Tuesday.

Then Salhi, a truck driver with a history of radical Islamic ties dating back to 2003, drove into the plant filled with flammable gas canisters, Molins said.

entry.title: Prosecutor: Beheading, French gas plant attack Islamic State trademark
Islamic State beheads women civilians for first time in Syria
entry.summary: Islamic State has beheaded local and foreign men in Syria, including enemy combatants, aid workers and journalists as well as people it has deemed as violating its hardline interpretation of Islamic law.

entry.title: Islamic State seen as potent force a year after caliphate declaration: Pentagon
Mali: Gunmen attack village near Ivory Coast border
entry.summary: Islamic extremists took control of northern Mali in 2012 following a military coup.

entry.title: Mali: Gunmen attack village near Ivory Coast border
entry.summary: BAMAKO, Mali (AP) " Gunmen identifying as Islamic extremists attacked and briefly occupied a village in southern Mali near Ivory Coast on Sunday before security forces drove them out, officials said.

entry.title: Afghan official: Islamic State group now present in 3 provinces
entry.summary: KABUL, Afghanistan - An Afghan official says the Islamic State group now has a presence in three provinces but that the government is determined to drive it out.

entry.title: Islamic State teenager said to be UK's youngest suicide bomber
Report: Islamic State Claims Credit for Attack at Tunisian Resort That Killed at Least 37
Islamic State suicide bomber kills 25, wounds 202 in Kuwait mosque
entry.summary: Islamic State had urged its followers on Tuesday to step up attacks during the Ramadan fasting month against Christians, Shi'ites and Sunni Muslims fighting with a U.S.-led coalition against the ultra-hardline jihadist group.

entry.title: Islamic State suicide bomber kills 27, wounds 227 in Kuwait mosque
entry.summary:
The Islamic State militant group claimed responsibility for the attack, which also wounded 227 people according to the interior ministry, in the district of Sawaber in the eastern part of the Kuwaiti capital.

Islamic State named the bomber as Abu Suleiman al-Muwahed and said in a statement posted on social media that he had targeted a "temple of the rejectionists" -- a term it generally uses to refer to Shi'ites, whom it regards as heretics.

entry.title: Islamic State hits Shiite mosque in Kuwait, killing 27 people
entry.summary: A posting on a Twitter account known to belong to the Islamic State affiliate that calls itself the Najd Province, claimed the explosion was the work of a suicide bomber.

entry.title: French beheading suspect previously investigated for radical Islamic ties
entry.summary:
followed a call by Islamic State extremists to target "nonbelievers."

The severed head appeared to mimic the Islamic State group's practice of beheading prisoners and displaying their heads for all to see, and came days after the militants urged attacks during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

A knife and the decapitated body of Salhi's employer were found at the site of the explosion, and the severed head was posted on a gate at the factory entrance with two flags bearing proclamations of Islamic faith, the prosecutor said.

entry.title: Islamic State kills at least 145 civilians in Syria's Kobani
entry.summary: While Islamic State had managed to advance slightly in Hasaka on Friday, seizing one army position, fierce army air strikes had hindered the attack, Abdulrahman said.

entry.title: Islamic State kills at least 145 civilians in Syria's Kobani
entry.summary:
BEIRUT Islamic State fighters killed at least 145 civilians in an attack on the Syrian town of Kobani and a nearby village, in what a monitoring group described on Friday as one of the worst massacres carried out by the hardline group in Syria.

Unlike the Kobani raid, the Islamic State attack on Hasaka appears aimed at wresting control of the government-held parts of city, which is divided into areas run separately by President Bashar al-Assad's government and the YPG.

entry.title: O'Malley: Islamic State a result of 'mindless rush to war'
entry.summary: Democratic presidential candidate Martin O'Malley said Friday the rise of the Islamic State group was an unintended consequence of a "mindless rush to war" in Iraq and the U.S. must avoid "mission creep" there now.

entry.title: Islamic State affiliate strikes Shiite mosque in Kuwait, killing 27 people
entry.summary:
The attack, which hit the capital of Kuwait City, was one of three deadly attacks from Europe to the Middle East on Friday that followed the Islamic State group's call for violence during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan.

The Islamic State extremists regard Shiite Muslims as heretics, and refer to them derogatively as "rejectionists."

entry.title: Vladimir Putin calls Barack Obama to discuss Ukraine and Islamic State
entry.summary: Obama and Putin also discussed Syria, where the self-proclaimed Islamic State group has made rapid gains, as well as historic negotiations between world powers and Iran over its disputed nuclear programme.

entry.title: Islamic State Militants Attack 2 Cities in Northern Syria
entry.summary: After weeks of setbacks, militants from the Islamic State group launched swift counteroffensives Thursday on predominantly Kurdish areas of northern Syria, killing and wounding dozens and setting off car bombs, activists and officials said.

entry.title: Islamic State militants attack 2 cities in northern Syria
entry.summary:
Turkish officials said on Thursday, June 25, 2015 that the Islamic State group has staged a new attack on the Kurdish town of Kobani, which resisted a months-long assault by the Islamic militants until they were pushed out earlier this year.

The two-pronged attack on the northeastern city of Hassakeh and the border town of Kobani came two days after an Islamic State spokesman acknowledged that the group might lose some battles but would not be defeated.

entry.title: North Carolina man charged in plot to kill Americans for Islamic State
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A North Carolina man has been charged with an alleged plot to buy a semiautomatic rifle which he planned to use to kill Americans to show his support for the Islamic State militant group, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Monday.

entry.title: Officials: North Carolina Teen Planned to Help ISIS
entry.summary:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) - A North Carolina man is in the custody of federal authorities, who say he planned assassinations in the United States in support of the Islamic State terrorist group.

Federal authorities said in a news release Monday that 19-year-old Justin Nojan Sullivan of Morganton faces several charges, including one count of attempting to provide material support to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Europol to battle Islamic State social media propaganda
Syrian Kurds, on the offensive, push deeper into Islamic State territory
entry.summary: Islamic State has held the base, "Liwa 93", since capturing it from the Syrian military last year.

entry.title: A short chronology of the Islamic State group
entry.summary:
In areas controlled by the Islamic State group in Iraq and Syria, women must not only be covered, but usually are required to wear all black, with flat-soled shoes; for men, Western clothes or hair styles - even hair gel - can draw suspicion.

FILE - This undated file image made from a video released by Islamic State militants Tuesday, Aug. 19, 2014, purports to show the killing of journalist James Foley by the militant group.

entry.title: A short chronology of the Islamic State group
entry.summary: June 16, 2015 - Kurds deal the Islamic State a major setback by capturing the Syrian town of Tal Abyad on the Turkish border, which had provided a strategic supply route to IS.

entry.title: Sunni Tribes, Abandoned by Iraq, Key to Islamic State Fight
entry.summary: Parading across a desert base, hundreds of Sunni tribesmen who graduated a crash training course stood ready to take on the Islamic State group on behalf of a government that many believed left them to die at the hands of the extremists.

entry.title: Sunni tribes, abandoned by Iraq, key to Islamic State fight
entry.summary: The Islamic State group has massacred hundreds of men, women and children with Anbar's Al Bu Nimr tribe for resisting their rule and cooperating with the Iraqi government.

entry.title: Islamic State-claimed car bombing kills 2 in Yemen's capital
entry.summary: The Islamic State group claimed the attack on a Twitter account associated with the extremists, saying it targeted Shiite Houthis, who the Sunni extremists view as heretics.

entry.title: Islamic State-claimed car bombing kills 2 in Yemen's capital
entry.summary: SANAA, Yemen (AP) - An Islamic State-claimed car bomb exploded outside a mosque in Yemen's capital Saturday, killing at least two people and wounding six amid the country's raging civil war, authorities said.

entry.title: Sunni tribes, abandoned by Iraq, key to Islamic State fight
entry.summary:
That night, silence fell over Ramadi after weeks of Islamic State-launched suicide car bomb attacks and gun battles, said Sunni tribesmen who spoke to The Associated Press.

Yet despite being targeting by the Islamic State group, many of the Sunni tribesmen from Anbar who spoke to the AP said the Baghdad government viewed them as being complicit in the extremists' advance, solely because they share the same sect.

entry.title: Sunni tribes, abandoned by Iraq, key to Islamic State fight
entry.summary: But money and weapons alone won't be enough to repair the mistrust between Baghdad and the Sunni tribes it now needs to battle the Islamic State group, which holds about a third of the country and neighboring Syria in its self-declared "caliphate."

entry.title: Burial set for American killed fighting Islamic State
entry.summary: Broomfield, 20 from Massachusetts, died June 3 in battle in a Syrian village near Kobani, making him likely the first U.S. citizen to die fighting alongside Kurds against the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Massachusetts man killed fighting Islamic State in Syria will be buried this week
entry.summary: BOSTON - Funeral arrangements for an American killed in Syria while fighting the Islamic State group have been set for later this week.

entry.title: Burial set for American killed fighting Islamic State
entry.summary: The YPG are the main Kurdish guerrillas battling the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Burial set for American killed fighting Islamic State
Libyan Islamists claim to drive Islamic State from port stronghold
entry.summary:
Street fighting has raged for several days between members of the local Islamist umbrella group Majlis Mujahideen and Islamic State loyalists, who have been trying to increase their influence in the port city for more than a year.

A Majlis spokesman told local Libyan Nabaa TV that more than 70 Islamic State militants had surrendered during the fighting, in which some were severely wounded.

Forces from both governments have been fighting Islamic State but also each other in a conflict where military alliances are often fluid and based on local interests.

entry.title: Syrian Kurds battle Islamic State for town at Turkish border
entry.summary:
YPG fighters were battling Islamic State militants at the eastern outskirts of Tel Abyad on Sunday, YPG spokesman Redur Xeili told Reuters.

An activist group, Raqqa is Being Slaughtered Silently, said on its Twitter feed that Islamic State had stripped a Tel Abyad hospital of all its equipment and had moved it to Raqqa city.

entry.title: Syrian Kurds battle Islamic State for town at Turkish border
entry.summary: While dealing a blow to Islamic State, seizing Tel Abyad would help the YPG to link up Kurdish-controlled areas of northern Syria.

entry.title: Kurds nearing key Islamic State-held Syrian border town
entry.summary:
Several militants pushed the refugees back towards the city but later the refugees massed again near the border fence as they flee nearby intense fighting between Syrian Kurds and militants from the Islamic State group.

Taking Tal Abyad, some 80 kilometers (50 miles) from the Islamic State stronghold of Raqqa, would mean the group wouldn't have a direct route to bring in new foreign militants or supplies.

Meanwhile, hundreds trying to flee the offensive pressed against the barbed wire fences separating the town from Turkey, as masked militants likely belonging to the Islamic State group could be seen as Turkish soldiers watched from the other side.

However, Rami Abdurrahman, who heads the Observatory, said Islamic State fighters still control the road linking the Turkish border with Raqqa.

entry.title: Kurds nearing key Islamic State-held Syrian border town
entry.summary: Kurdish official Idriss Naasan said Sunday that Islamic State fighters have fled from Suluk, a few kilometers (miles) southwest of Tal Abyad, and that Kurds now hold the town.

entry.title: Ethnic cleansing claims as Kurds take fight to Islamic State in Syria
entry.summary:
Beirut: Kurdish fighters have advanced to the outskirts of a key Syrian border town held by Islamic State, as Turkish forces sought to prevent thousands fleeing the fighting from crossing the frontier.

The Kurdish People's Protection Units (YPG) have edged closer to Tal Abyad, a border town used by jihadists as a gateway from Turkey into Syria's Raqqa province, the Islamic State's stronghold.

Islamic State fighters discuss the situation at the border fence.

entry.title: Rival Libya militants fight Islamic State amid suicide bombings
entry.summary:
But local residents say Majlis Mujahideen, with local armed people, have pushed Islamic State out of much of Derna, taking back the courthouse, and killing several of the group's fighters including an Egyptian.

Islamic State is mostly in the Ras El Hilal and Fattiah areas of the city, residents said.

Derna, a conservative city where Islamist hardliners resisted Muammar Gaddafi before his 2011 fall, was the first place Islamic State tried to gain support in Libya.

entry.title: Syrian Kurds push deeper into Islamic State stronghold
entry.summary: The advance raises the prospect of a battle at the Turkish border between the well-organized YPG militia and Islamic State.

entry.title: House passes defense spending bill
entry.summary: On Wednesday, Obama ordered the deployment of up to 450 more American troops to Iraq in an effort to reverse major battlefield losses to the Islamic State, an escalation but not a significant shift in the struggling U.S. strategy to defeat the extremist group.

entry.title: House passes defense spending bill
entry.summary: Before the final vote, the House rejected an amendment to force lawmakers to vote by the end of March on new war powers to fight Islamic State militants.

entry.title: Pentagon: Price tag for war on Islamic State is $2.7 billion, most of it for Air Force
entry.summary: WASHINGTON - The Pentagon says the U.S. has spent more than $2.7 billion on the war against Islamic State militants in Iraq and Syria since bombings began last August, and the average daily cost is now more than $9 million.

entry.title: Teen pleads guilty to helping friend join Islamic State
entry.summary: Authorities said Amin was a sophisticated user of social media and that he also helped people make anonymous financial contributions to the Islamic State using Bitcoin.

entry.title: Teen pleads guilty to helping friend join Islamic State
entry.summary:
The court documents indicate Amin referred to Niknejad as "ex-Shia" in his contacts facilitating Niknejad's travel - the Islamic State organization is dominated by Sunni extremists.

Last year, Amin's Twitter feed drew the attention of the State Department, which under its "Think Again Turn Away" social media campaign sought to counter Amin's glorification of the Islamic State and debated him directly online, at one point telling AmreekiWitness to "join reality."

entry.title: Teen Pleads Guilty to Helping Friend Join Islamic State
entry.summary:
A 17-year-old who otherwise would have been graduating with honors from high school this week instead pleaded guilty Thursday to terrorism charges for helping another teen travel to Syria to join the Islamic State.

In addition to helping 18-year-old Reza Niknejad of Prince William County travel to Syria, Amin also admitted using Twitter and other social media to solicit donations and support for the Islamic State.

entry.title: American teenager pleads guilty to charges of helping Islamic State
entry.summary: A 17-year-old from Virginia pleaded guilty in court on Thursday to charges of conspiring to help Islamic State militants, the first time the United States has prosecuted a minor as an adult in such a case.

entry.title: US prosecutors in New York City charge 5th man in Islamic State group recruitment plot case
entry.summary: Prosecutors accused Zakirov of plotting to pay for one of his co-defendants to fly to the Middle East to join the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Virginia 17-year-old pleads guilty to helping Islamic State via Twitter
entry.summary: Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson was meeting on Thursday with a Muslim group in nearby Sterling as part of the department's outreach to Islamic communities around the country.

entry.title: Virginia 17-year-old pleads guilty to helping to Islamic State
entry.summary:
"Around the nation, we are seeing ISIL use social media to reach out from the other side of the world," Assistant Attorney General John Carlin said in a statement, using an acronym for Islamic State.

As part of the plea agreement, Amin admitted to using Twitter, with the handle @Amreekiwitness, to provide advice, encouragement and resources to Islamic State and its supporters.

He also admitted he helped Reza Niknejad, an 18-year-old Prince William County resident, travel to Syria to join Islamic State in January.

entry.title: U.S. military considering more Anbar-style hubs in Iraq: officer
entry.summary:
NAPLES, Italy (Reuters) - The United States is considering replicating the creation of a new U.S. military hub in Anbar elsewhere in Iraq as the campaign against Islamic State advances, the top U.S. military officer said on Thursday.

The hub will be located at the Taqaddum military base, which is only about 15 miles (25 km) from Ramadi, the capital of Anbar province, which fell to Islamic State militants last month.

entry.title: Dempsey says new US military base in Iraq could be model
entry.summary: Dempsey said another could eventually be established in north-central Iraq if and when the Iraqi army is ready to organize a counteroffensive in Mosul, which has been in Islamic State hands for 12 months.

entry.title: Gen. Dempsey says new US military base in Iraq could be model in battle against Islamic State
entry.summary: NAPLES, Italy - The Pentagon's top general says the new U.S. military base being setting up in Iraq's western desert could be a model for more such U.S. hubs if Iraq is able to regain momentum against the Islamic State group.

entry.title: American fighting with Kurds killed in Islamic State battle
entry.summary: Many are spurred on by Kurdish social media campaigners and a sense of duty rooted in the 2003 U.S.-led military invasion of Iraq, where Islamic State fighters recently have rolled back gains U.S. troops had made.

entry.title: More US troops to Iraq: How it will work
entry.summary: WASHINGTON (AP) " The latest expansion of the U.S. mission in Iraq centers on bringing Sunni tribes into the fight, a critical goal in the campaign to defeat the Islamic State group.

entry.title: American fighting with Kurds killed in Islamic State battle
entry.summary: The fight against the Islamic State group has attracted dozens of Westerners, including a number of Iraq war veterans who have made their way back to the Middle East to join Kurdish fighters, who have been most successful against the extremist group.

entry.title: History of the Islamic State group 1 year after Mosul seized
entry.summary: June 29 - The group declares the establishment of an Islamic state, or caliphate, in territories it controls in Iraq and Syria and demands allegiance from Muslims worldwide.

entry.title: Iraq suffers amid disarray 1 year after Islamic State group took Mosul, a third of the country
entry.summary:
The collapse of Iraqi security forces, which received billions of dollars in aid and training from the U.S. during its occupation, haunts this divided country today, a year after the Islamic State group seized Mosul and a third of the country.

Weeks later, Islamic State leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi purportedly spoke at Mosul's main mosque and the group declared a "caliphate" over territory it controlled, demanding the loyalty of the world's Muslims.

entry.title: The unbelievable damage Islamic State has done to ancient sites in Iraq and Syria
entry.summary:
As the Islamic State continues its efforts to create a "caliphate," killing thousands in its path, the group is also pursuing another campaign: the destruction of historic sites.

Video released by the Islamic State shows the militants pulverising carvings, statues and walls, using guns, sledgehammers and pickaxes.

In February, the Islamic State went to the Nineveh Museum in Mosul and used sledgehammers to smash artifacts that were known as some of the most cherished of pre-Islamic antiquity.

entry.title: The unbelievable damage Islamic State has done to ancient sites in Iraq and Syria
entry.summary: An Islamic State militant destroys the statue of Lamassu, an Assyrian deity, with a jackhammer in the northern Iraqi Governorate of Nineveh.

entry.title: IS, al-Qaida militants clash in Libya after leader killed
entry.summary:
BENGHAZI, Libya (AP) - Al-Qaida-linked militants are battling an Islamic State affiliate in eastern Libya after one of their leaders was shot dead by masked gunmen.

Akr's group, known as the Shura Council of Darna's Jihadists, announced his killing in a statement on Wednesday, blaming it on Islamic State militants and vowing retaliation.

entry.title: Libya talks endangered as Islamic State group advances
entry.summary: The threat of the Islamic State group, which already holds two cities and several towns in Libya, is one of the factors fueling the United Nations' push to resolve the country's chronic chaos.

entry.title: Russian security czar worried about Islamic State recruiters
entry.summary:
MOSCOW (AP) " Russia's security chief says recruiters of the Islamic State group are active in the country and called for closer international cooperation to combat them.

He said the Islamic State and other terror groups are focusing on youth and ethnic minorities in trying to find supporters.

entry.title: State Department spokesman: Overcoming Islamic State onslaught in Iraq could take 3-5 years
entry.summary: WASHINGTON - An Obama administration official says it could take at least three to five years for Iraq to overcome the Islamic State onslaught.

entry.title: Islamic State seizes power plant near Libyan city of Sirte
entry.summary: Since the start of the year militants in Libya loyal to Islamic State have claimed responsibility for killing dozens of Egyptian and Ethiopian Christians, as well attacks on Tripoli's luxury Corinthia hotel, embassies and oilfields.

entry.title: Islamic State attacks government office on western fringe of Baghdad
entry.summary: Located on the western fringe of Baghdad, Amiriyat al-Falluja is one of the few remaining pockets of territory under government control in Anbar province, most of which is held by Islamic State.

entry.title: Islamic State seizes power plant near Libyan city of Sirte
entry.summary:
"The plant ... was taken," Islamic State said in a message on social media, adding that the capture of the plant meant that the militants had driven their enemies out of the entire city.

Forces loyal to the self-declared government that controls the capital Tripoli pulled out of the plant after Islamic State attacked it on Tuesday morning.

entry.title: France proves fertile ground for Islamic State recruitment
entry.summary: The number of French recruits to Islamic State is rising unstoppably, in spite of waves of new measures to halt it, according to French officials.

entry.title: The Islamic State: A year of death and destruction
entry.summary: The Islamic State jihadist group launched a sweeping offensive a year ago that overran large chunks of Iraqi territory, led to thousands of deaths and displaced millions of people.

entry.title: Jordan military unveils anti-Islamic State surveillance system on border with Syria, Iraq
entry.summary:
BORDER GUARD FORCES COMMAND, Jordan - Jordan's military has installed the second phase of a surveillance system that U.S. officials say provides an effective defense against infiltration attempts by Islamic State militants.

Jordan plays a high-profile role in the U.S.-led military coalition against Islamic State which controls large parts of neighboring Syria and Iraq and also poses a threat to the kingdom's security.

entry.title: Islamic State: not just beheadings but taxes and business rules too
entry.summary: While IS charges zakat - an Islamic alms payment similar to income tax - from those who can afford it, Ammar says that in return businesses are protected from theft and corruption.

entry.title: LONDON (AP) - Prime Minister David Cameron says Britain will send 125 more troops to Iraq to train local forces fighting the Islamic State group.
